title: The Medieval Islamic Civilization - C.5 (History, Legacy 2)
description:
The Medieval Islamic Civilization - Collection 5 (History, Legacy 2):

Here are 4 more special uploads about the medieval Islamic civilization. We start with 28 titles in this upload:

-  Afsaruddin - The First Muslims; History and Memory (2007)

-  Ahmed - Discovering Islam; Making Sense of Muslim History and Society (2002)

-  Anooshahr - The Ghazi Sultans and the Frontiers of Islam (2009)

-  Armstrong - Islam; a Short History (2002)

-  Arnold - The Preaching of Islam; a History of the Propagation of the Muslim Faith, 2e (1913)

-  Avari - Islamic Civilization in South Asia; a History of Muslim Power and Presence in the Indian Subcontinent (2013)

-  Ayoub - Islam; Faith and History (2004)

-  Douglass - World Eras, Vol. 2; Rise and Spread of Islam, 622-1500 (2002)

-  Eaton - The Rise of Islam and the Bengal Frontier, 1204-1760 (1993)

-  Endress - Islam; an Historical Introduction, 2e (2002)

-  Faruqui - The Princes of the Mughal Empire, 1504-1719 (2012)

-  Fierro - 'Abd al-Rahman III; the First Cordoban Caliph (2005)

-  Fromherz - The Almohads; the Rise of an Islamic Empire (2010)

-  Hoyland - In God's Path; the Arab Conquests and the Creation of an Islamic Empire (2015)

-  Kennedy - The Great Arab Conquests; How the Spread of Islam Changed the World We Live In (2007)

-  Lev - Charity, Endowments, and Charitable Institutions in Medieval Islam (2005)

-  Marozzi - Tamerlane; Sword of Islam, Conqueror of the World (2004)

-  Nicolle - Saracen Strongholds, 1100-1500, the Central and Eastern Islamic Lands (2009)

-  Nicolle - The Great Islamic Conquests, AD 632-750 (2009)

-  Nicolle - Yarmuk 636 AD; the Muslim Conquest of Syria (1994)

-  Nicolle & McBride - Mughul India 1504-1761 (1993)

-  Nigosian - Islam; Its History, Teaching, and Practices (2004)

-  Peacock - Mediaeval Islamic Historiography and Political Legitimacy (2007)

-  Rossabi - Khubilai Khan; His Life and Times (1988)

-  Sadeghi et al (Eds.) - Islamic Cultures, Islamic Contexts; Essays in Honor of Professor Patricia Crone (2015)

-  Sela - The Legendary Biographies of Tamerlane; Islam and Heroic Apocrypha in Central Asia (2011)

-  Starr - Lost Enlightenment; Central Asia's Golden Age from the Arab Conquest to Tamerlane (2013)

-  Stewart - Great Ages of Man; Early Islam (1967)
